intro: Eugenia foxworthiana, commonly known as the foxworthian eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers. It produces small, edible berries that are often used in local cuisines. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
